casebody.data:
STATE OF MONTANA, Plaintiff, vs. SHAWN A. HOSSACK, Defendant. No. DC-99-124(A)

Decision

On October 1, 2003, the defendant was sentenced to Ten (10) years in the Montana State Prison, suspended in its entirety, to run consecutive to the sentence imposed in Cause No. DC-97-06KB), for violations of the conditions of a suspended sentence for the offense of Forgery, a Felony Common Scheme.

On June 10, 2004, the defendant's application for review of that sentence was heard by the Sentence Review Division of the Montana Supreme Court.

The defendant was present and was represented by David Stufft. The state was represented by Lori Adams.

Before hearing the application, the defendant was advised that the Sentence Review Division has the authority not only to reduce the sentence or affirm it, but also increase it. The defendant was further advised that there is no appeal from a decision of the Sentence Review Division. The defendant acknowledged that he understood this and stated that he wished to proceed.

Rule 17 of the Riiles of the Sentence Review Division of the Supreme Court of Montana provides that “the sentence imposed by the District Court is presumed correct, and the sentence will not be reduced or increased unless it is deemed clearly inadequate or excessive.” (§46-18-904(3), MCA).

*48DATED this 25th day of June, 2004.

The Division finds that the reasons advanced for modification are insufficient to hold that the sentence imposed by the District Court is inadequate or excessive.

Therefore, it is the unanimous decision of the Sentence Review Division that the sentence shall be affirmed.

Done in open Court this 10th day of June, 2004.

Chairperson, Hon. Marc G. Buyske, Member, Hon. Gary L. Day and Member, Hon. John W. Whelan.
